member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.AnnotationLayer
member.summary: Represents the base class for annotation layer types. Annotations will usually disable some of the default hover/touch behaviors of the chart when they are introduced to the series collection. In return they provide some valuable information as the cursor is moved by hovering over the chart, or performing a press-hold-drag interaction in touch mode.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Series.GetDistanceToIndex(System.Windows.Point,System.Int32,Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Axis,Infragistics.Controls.Charts.ScalerParams,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns a distance value (not necessarily pixels), that indicates how 'close' a world position is to an indexed value in the series. Not every series can necessarily answer this question, it can't or the world position or index is invalid, NaN will be returned.
member.param: The world position for which to get a distance.
The index to get a distance to.
member.returns: A distance value to the world position.

member.summary: Helps determine the distance to an index from a world position. Distance is not necessarily in pixels.
member.param: The world position to get a distance to.
The index to get a distance from.
The axis the represents the indexes.
The scaler parameters of the axis.
The category offset, if any.
The number of items in the data source.
Gets an exact unsorted index for a sorted axis.
member.returns: The distance value.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Series.GetSeriesValue(System.Windows.Point,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: If possible, will return the best available main value of the series for a given world coordinate.
member.param: The world coordinate for which to get the value for.
If true, interpolation should be used to get in-between values, rather than only the actual values in the data set.
If true, when searching for the best available value any unknown values will be skipped.
member.returns: The value in question, or double.NaN if no valid value is available.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Series.Legend
member.summary: Gets or sets a legend for the current series object.
member.remarks:
If the Legend property is not set, the series will use the setting according to the parent XamDataChart's Legend property.
This is generally expressed as an element name binding, as the Legend must exist at some other position in the layout. This property only indicates which Legend to use and will not alone cause the legend to be visible.

member.summary:

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.AnnotationLayer.CursorPosition
member.summary:
Gets or sets the world position to use instead of the mouse position for this annotation layer. If you set this value, rather than responding to the mouse cursor, this layer will be fixed on the provided world position. A world position has x and y values that range from 0 to 1 that represent the global position of the cursor relative to the entire ranges of the axes. The default of (NaN, NaN) means that the layer should react to mouse movement.
This is a dependency property.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.CategoryHighlightLayer
member.summary:
Represents an annotation layer that targets a category axis, or all category axes in the chart. If the axis contains any series that are aligned between major gridlines of the axis (column, waterfall, etc) this will render a shape that fills the current category. Otherwise it will render a band with an adjustable thickness at the closest gridline to the mouse position.
Setting UseIterpolation to true will cause the x position in the latter case to become affixed to the x position of the cursor.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.CategoryItemHighlightLayer
member.summary:
Represents an annotation layer that highlights items in a series that use a category axis either by drawing a banded shape at their position, or by rendering a marker at their position.
Depending on the type of series, the default highlight will be affected. To override the type of highlight used, you can set the HighlightType property.

member.summary: Determines the distance to the corner on the cartesian axis aligned bounding rectangle that is furthest from the provided point.
member.param: The point to determine distance to.
The cartesian axis aligned rectangle.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.PolarAxisRenderingManager.GetClosestRadiusValue(System.Windows.Rect)
member.summary: Determines the smallest radius that is visible in the current view into the chart.
member.param: The window rectangle.
member.returns: The radius value.
member.remarks:
This makes use of the fact that the view into the chart is aligned on the cartesian axes.
So, if the center point of the chart is inside the viewable space, the minimum radius is 0.
If the view into the chart is scrolled above or below the center point, such that the center point is in the X range of the view, then the closest radius is just the distance to the top or bottom edge of the window rectangle.
Similarly, if the view into the chart is left of right of the center point, such that the center point is in the Y range of the view, then the closest radius is just the distance to the left of right edge of the window rectangle.
In the case where the view is deeper into the quadrants of the space, and the center point is neither in the X or Y range of the view, then we simply need to determine what the distance is to the closest corner of the rectangle.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.PolarAxisRenderingManager.GetFurthestRadiusValue(System.Windows.Rect)
member.summary: Determines the furthest radius value that is viewable in the current view into the chart.
member.param: The window rectangle.
member.returns: The radius value.
member.remarks: In all cases the furthest distance will just be the distance to the furthest corner of the viewing rectangle in scaled viewport space.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.SeriesViewer.Flush
member.summary: Use to force the SeriesViewer to finish any deferred work before printing or evaluating its visual.
member.remarks: This should only be called if the visual of the SeriesViewer needs to be synchronously saved or evaluated. Calling this method too often will hinder the performance of the SeriesViewer.

member.summary: Gets or sets which legend to use for all series in this SeriesViewer, unless otherwise specified by the Series.Legend property.
member.remarks: This is generally expressed as an element name binding, as the Legend must exist at some other position in the layout. This property only indicates which Legend to use and will not alone cause the legend to be visible.

member.summary: Gets the EffectiveViewport rectangle, representing the effective viewport area after margins have been subtracted.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.SeriesViewer.WindowRect
member.summary: A rectangle representing the portion of the SeriesViewer currently in view.
member.remarks: A rectangle at X=0, Y=0 with a Height and Width of 1 implies the entire plotting area is in view. A Height and Width of .5 would imply that the view is halfway zoomed in.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.SeriesViewer.UseTiledZooming
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the series viewer should use cached tiles during zooms rather than the default live content.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.SeriesViewer.ActualUseTiledZooming
member.summary: Gets if we are currently should be using tiled zoom/pans

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.SeriesViewer.PreferHigherResolutionTiles
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the series viewer should prefer selecting higher resolution tiles over lower resolution tiles when performing tile zooming. Setting this to true will lower performance but increase quality.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.SeriesViewer.ZoomTileCacheSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of zoom tiles that the series viewer should cache while in tiled zooming mode.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.SeriesViewer.ActualZoomTileCacheSize
member.summary: Gets if we are currently should be using tiled zoom/pans

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.SeriesViewer.IsTileZoomRunning
member.summary: Gets if there is a tiled zoom running.

member.summary:
Gets or sets the duration the highlighting/de-highlighting effects.
This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.SeriesViewer.IsSurfaceInteractionDisabled
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether all surface interactions with the plot area should be disabled.
This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.SeriesViewer.Anchor
member.summary: anchor (mouse down or multi-touch) in grid area coordinates.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Controls.SeriesViewer.WindowRectChanged
member.summary: Occurs just after the current SeriesViewer's window rectangle is changed.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Controls.SeriesViewer.ActualWindowRectChanged
member.summary: Raised when the actual window rectangle of the SeriesViewer changes.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Controls.SeriesViewer.GridAreaRectChanged
member.summary: Occurs just after the current SeriesViewer's grid area rectangle is changed.
member.remarks: The grid area may change as the result of the SeriesViewer being resized, or of an axis being added or changing size, possibly in another SeriesViewer.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.SeriesViewer.WindowResponse
member.summary: The response to user panning and zooming: whether to update the view immediately while the user action is happening, or to defer the update to after the user action is complete. The user action will be an action such as a mouse drag which causes panning and/or zooming to occur.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.SeriesViewer.WindowRectMinWidth
member.summary:
Sets or gets the minimum width that the window rect is allowed to reach before being clamped. Decrease this value if you want to allow for further zooming into the viewer. If this value is lowered too much it can cause graphical corruption due to floating point arithmetic inaccuracy.
This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.SeriesViewer.ShoulKeepResourcesOnUnload
member.summary:
Gets or sets a whether the series viewer's components should hold their resource when unloaded.
This is a dependency property.
Note, when setting this to true, it becomes the user's responsibility to set the ItemsSource of the various series and axes to null when the chart is unloaded or memory leaks will occur. This property is useful however, if unloaded charts must be examined or printed, or when expensive to load charts are on multiple tabs on a tab control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.SeriesViewer.ShouldFreezeBrushes
member.summary:
Gets or sets a whether the series viewer should auto-freeze brushes brushes that are provided to it.
This is a dependency property.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.ChartCollection
member.summary: Represents an observable collection of Chart objects.
member.remarks:
It is not possible to clear the contents of a ChartCollection collection; the Chart objects must be removed one at a time.
Changing the name of a Chart will generate a collection changed (Replace) event.

member.summary: Occurs just before the current chart collection contents are reset

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.ChartAreaPanel
member.summary: Represents a specialized panel used to layout the contents of Charts.
member.remarks: The ChartAreaPanel is used internally by the chart to handle the rather complicated layout of its central area, which requires collaboration between the owner chart and the other chart objects.

member.remarks: A contract is defined between the financial series and these simple indicator calculations detailing the data which the series agrees to provide the simple indicator calculations, this contract is defined by . member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.FinancialCalculationDataSource
member.summary: Represents the data contract between a financial series and the decoupled calculation responsibilities which implement its mathmatical logic.
member.remarks: The FinancialCalculationDataSource contract represents the subset of data which needs to be provided in order to test or run a calculation, and its intentionally a subset of the information available to the series, in order to make calculation strategies more easily testable and usable in isolation to the financial series container.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.ItemwiseStrategyBasedIndicator
member.summary: Financial indicator base class for doing calculating an itemwize indicator.
member.remarks: An itemwise indicator's individual values don't depend on any other values in the collection so can always be independantly recalculated. Also, because of this, the base class handles all the looping logic and inheritors only need to provide the actual calculation.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.ValueOverlay.GetSeriesValue(System.Windows.Point,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: If possible, will return the best available main value of the series for a given world coordinate.
member.param: The world coordinate for which to get the value for.
If true, interpolation should be used to get in-between values, rather than only the actual values in the data set.
If true, when searching for the best avaialble value any unknown values will be skipped.
member.returns: The value in question, or double.NaN if no valid value is available.

member.param: The world coordinate for which to get a value position for
If true, interpolation should be used to get in-between values, rather than only the actual values in the data set.
If true, unknown values will be skipped when searching for a series value.
member.returns: The position in question, or NaN,NaN if no valid position is available.

member.summary: Returns a distance value (not necessarily pixels), that indicates how 'close' a world position is to an indexed value in the series. Not every series can necessarily answer this question, it can't or the world position or index is invalid, NaN will be returned.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.AnchoredRadialSeries.GetSeriesValue(System.Windows.Point,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: If possible, will return the best available main value of the series for a given world coordinate.
member.param: The world coordinate for which to get the value for.

member.returns: The value in question, or double.NaN if no valid value is available.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.AnchoredRadialSeries.GetSeriesValuePosition(System.Windows.Point,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)

member.param: The world coordinate for which to get a value position for
If true, interpolation should be used to get in-between values, rather than only the actual values in the data set.
If true, unknown values will be skipped when searching for a series value.
member.returns: The position in question, or NaN,NaN if no valid position is available.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.StackedFragmentSeries.EndCap
member.summary: The style of the end point of any lines or polylines representing this series.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.StackedFragmentSeries.StartCap
member.summary: The style of the starting point of any lines or polylines representing this series.
member.remarks: Not every series type has a line at which it would be appropriate to display a start cap, so this property does not affect every series type. LineSeries, for example, is affected by StartCap, but ColumnSeries is not.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Util.Partitioner
member.summary: Utility class for range partitioning.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Util.Partitioner.PartitionByValue``1(System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0},``0,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.remarks:
The list is reordered such that list[0] to list[k-1] are less than list[k] and all items list[k+1] to list[list.Count-1] are greater than list[k].
The items within the upper and lower subranges are in no particular order, and specifically are not sorted.
member.param: List of values to partition.
Pivot value.
Index of first item in subrange.
Index of last item in subrange.
member.returns: Index of first item greater than the specified pivot value.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Util.Partitioner.PartitionByValue``1(System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Int32},``0,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.param: List of values.
List of indices to partition.
Pivot value.
Index of first index in subrange.
Index of last index in subrange.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Util.Partitioner.Partition``1(System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0},System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the kth biggest item in the current list object and partitions the list accordingly.
member.remarks:
The list is reordered such that list[0] to list[k-1] are less than list[k] and all items list[k+1] to list[list.Count-1] are greater than list[k].
The items within the upper and lower subranges are in no particular order, and specifically are not sorted.
member.param: List object to partition.
Pivot item order.
member.returns: Pivot item value.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Util.Partitioner.Partition``1(System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0},System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the kth biggest item in the specified subrange of the current list object and partitions it accordingly.
member.remarks:
The list is reordered such that list[position] to list[position+k-1] are less than list[position+k] and all items list[position+k+1] to list[position+Count] are greater than list[k].
The items within the upper and lower subranges are in no particular order, and specifically are not sorted.

member.summary: Indirect selection and partition.
